content: grandmother s favorite baby bib by merin mcmanus collins inspired by grandmother s favorite dishcloth and simple baby bib this bib came to be after a particularly fertile year among my circle of acquaintances i was turning out grandmother s favorite dishcloths for baby gifts left and right and decided i wanted a matching bib three strap variations are included for your convenience size one finished measurements approximately 7 inches square with 8 to 9 inch strap materials 40-60 yds ~1 ounce worsted weight cotton yarn such as lily sugar n cream peaches n cream or lion cotton us 7 8 or 9 4 5-5 5 mm needles notions required tapestry needle one button approximately ¾ inch in diameter optional depending on strap one ¾ inch square of velcro optional depending on strap gauge gauge is unimportant just keep in mind that the finished product will shrink with washing and stretch when wet pattern notes one bib requires approximately 1 ounce of worsted weight cotton yarn pattern co 4 stitches row 1 knit row 2 k2 yo *k* repeat row 2 until you have 44 stitches next row k1 k2tog yo k2tog *k* repeat this row until you have 25 stitches bind off 20 stitches 5 stitches left strap variation #1 knit every row of the remaining 5 stitches until the strap is 7 to 8 inches long next row buttonhole row k2 yo k2tog k1 knit 5 row even repeat buttonhole row knit 5 row even repeat buttonhole row knit 5 row even bind off sew button to body of bib strap variation #2 knit every row of the 5 remaining stitches until strap is desired length bind off sew button to end of strap using the existing yos in the pattern as buttonholes strap variation #3 knit every row of the remaining 5 stitches until strap is 4 to 4 5 inches long bind off pick up 5 stitches at the other end of the bib and knit a second strap to the same length bind off sew velcro to ends about the designer merin and her husband live in oklahoma with their cat and four ferrets she works primarily to support her yarn habit and longs for the day when she can quit her job and become a lady of leisure every once in a while she remembers she has a blog http //nekkidknitter blogspot com and posts something this pattern is provided free for non-commercial use if you find that you enjoy it enough to pay for it my creditors would greatly appreciate a donation in whatever amount you choose to dollfaceatureachdotcom but
